bow: terrified of labour help hello calling out to all women who have bore child am currently 32 weeks pregnant and absolutely terrified of labour every time think about it get the worst feeling in the pit of my stomach and honestly ca convince myself thay can do this if anyone has tips or anything to say that will boost my confidence it would be amazing thanks about months in with my first decided changed my mind and did actually want to have baby after all unfortunately it does work that way towards the end you will be so unbelievably uncomfortable that the process of getting the baby out will be less unpleasant than living with the baby still in and if not well that what epidurals are for there are childbirth awards if you do it drug free also take childbirth prep class they ll walk you through the process and give you pain management techniques you can practice at home the thing the helped me most was reading birth stories on birth without fear facebook page it showed me so many ways to give birth it calmed me and let me know it was all going to be alright started telling myself that be able to do this it what my body was designed to do it was still scary but it did help lot what worked for me was remembering that every human mother back to the dawn of time has done it not to mention every other mammal mother and many of them birth litters not crunchy granola mother but knowing it perfectly normal and natural to birth child was remarkably reassuring to me always recommend reading ina may guide to childbirth to first timers it covers birth stories and everything that happens during birth found that knowing everything helped me focus on helping my body do what it was doing my labor ended up being 10 hour non event have list of things that hurt worse my biggest thing was being so tired went into labor right as was going to sleep so no rest for us spoon full of honey helped greatly though most of all start with positive words to yourself half of the battle is mental so you have to be prepared you can and you will have baby think of the little engine that could you can you can you can for me it was the realization that women have been having babies for well *ever* also that it okay to let medical science help you through your birth if that what you want that what offered me the most comfort most importantly sorry did mean to yell it your birth **yours** you get to choose if you use midwife or not if you give birth at home or not if you use tub or not if you get an epidural or not do let the stress of the activity outweigh the outcome *baby* after my eldest was born said really glad that she here but never want to do that again then had one more you can do the thing so labor does start out as unbearable pain it starts out as being uncomfortable antsy or just plain off there was at least for me pretty instinctive feel about it know that needed to do something just did know what the feelings build as the contractions do they taper and then surge back as things progress you will find yourself in pain but my body did register it was pain it just felt like this giant wave of pressure that had to bear through once my waters broke and was pretty far into labor 7cm it started to hurt my son was sunny side up and his fat head got stuck on my pelvic bone my body was working overtime to turn him and every contraction pushed him against me which felt like someone pushing my lower body in half outwards this is where tapped out and asked for an epidural but was having twins and knew could give birth twice with how hard my body was working the epidural helped me relax and then the real work started pushing was an enormous effort not pain but sheer exhaustion it felt like had just run marathon and now someone was forcing me to climb mountain when he was actually born it was such relief just because could finally rest and then do it all over again 20 min later point being you can do it it is like being stabbed or shot or maimed it like your body flipping it self inside out it will hurt but not as much as you think it will be absolutely exhausting but you are strong enough to do it had my first without pain meds and did think it was so bad was open to anything going in and did do any special prep and was pleasantly surprised at how manageable it was for me put it at 10 on the pain scale it felt like really bad intestinal cramps like when you get this awful twinge in your gut and you know that later you re gon na have big problem but right now you just got ta suck it up until it showtime it like that except that you re screaming pooping and vomiting it became all mental once the contractions settled into every two minutes watch the clock for two minutes breathe count for one minute then rest when transition ended it did hurt at all anymore just had to push the ring of fire was great but did feel much had minor tear on sensitive part of my anatomy that had no idea had happened the worst part was afterwards had blood clot in my uterus and the doctor had to scoop it out with her hand with no pain meds right after having baby 10 10 do recommend it is terrifying and you will probably have moments of panic about it until it happens lean on your partner or whoever comprises your support system and do expect everything to happen according to plan once you hit 36 weeks you will start to get really uncomfortable and may begin looking forward to labor because you get to be done being pregnant it not horrible really it sucks but had doc who epiduraled me up good as early as wanted and watched crappy morning tv while waiting to be completely dilated my 10lb baby was born in under min painless thanks to the epi no tearing easy you are afraid of the unknown but for every scary birth story there are 10 boring uneventful ones you ll do great go get massage get your nails done enjoy your last trimester had an induction at 37 weeks inductions are suppose to be more painful than natural labor at that could have any drugs due to medical issue my labor was surprisingly fine it took hours and he came out without any tears contractions were fine until 4cm then they broke my water which gave me shitload of relief because the water added lot of pressure after that my contractions came every few minutes and was able to *understand* them they felt like ball of energy right in my lower abdomen my contractions did radiate or anything so it was just to the one area when they were over fell asleep for few minutes heating pads were god send they were able to reduce any feeling of contractions by *a lot* you have to understand that any pain during labor is pain from being injured it pain with goal contractions are very terrible it very very important to go in with very positive mindset and do allow anyone to say negative things kicked my mil out because she made negative comments about the pitocin and only wanted positive vibes pushing does hurt so do be afraid of that pushing is very reliving when you push you do feel the contractions and there no feeling below perhaps due to adrenaline do know why once the baby is out it completely and totally over had the worst fear of labor to the point where took birth control all my life and had anxiety attacks just thinking about it worked out lot during pregnancy and watched my weight in order to have little personal control over things like having high blood pressure which can be caused by excessive weight gain during pregnancy went into my labor knowing that everything would be nothing but peace and no drama do not be afraid to kick people out who are making comments like glad not giving birth or this is why do want kids ***nothing but positive energy*** my labor took hours and had no tearing also when had contractions breathed in very deeply and rocked my hips towards the end allowed myself to have few screams which felt nice but save those screams for the end contractions are not bad contractions are not scary labor was so good that excited to get pregnant again and this is coming from rape survivor who has lot of anxiety and fear about everything you can do this but again only positive people allowed edit just answering ops question what with the downvotes removed you can do this it may be long and it may hurt but your body was literally made to do this thing you re doing afterwards you get little squishy person to love even when they crap and puke all over you you love them deep breaths it ll be okay was frantic for my epidural they even gave me another pain killer to take into could get my anesthesiologist to show up because my pregnancy was pure hell and they could tell was miserable literally the only positive thing about my pregnancy was that only gained weight in my belly although it was heavy as hell gaining 70lbs in my mid section if you need medical intervention get it and do let anyone shame you or make you feel like you are somehow less than any other mom because you took meds to help you ll do great deep breaths again and read anything you can about births suggest not reading about others traumatic births it ll just make things more stressful which is why not talking about mine friend have had two drug free child births the most hard and amazing things have ever done here are some quotes that bring me to tears about childbirth from jan may gaskin believe the act of giving birth to be the single most miraculous thing human being can do and it is surely the moment when lot of women finally understand the depth of their power and connection to all of nature you think it can possibly be done you think you can possibly take the pain and then you do and afterward you look at yourself in whole new way if you can do that you can do anything check out the books on this subject by ina may gaskin she one of my great heroes was so terrified of labor would shake when thought about it went to birthing classes and watched youtube videos of birth to try and prepare do know that it made labor birth any less scary though but once was in labor it like some other part of my brain just took over and all could think of was the moment and getting through it like did have time to be scared was busy focusing on my body and what was happening and then it was over and we were ok thought pushing would be painful but it actually gave little relief do know about others but as soon as my son was born felt great rush of endorphins probably it was til the next day was bit sore but it was very manageable do get me wrong the pain of labor was intense but not as horrific as imagined did opt for an epidural after point but thinking back the pain of it isnt really what remember picked hospital close by and where felt safe so think that helped me feel prepared too read ina may gaskin guide to labor the first half of the book is full of positive birth stories it good to read and understand that everyone has different experience with birth the second half of the book covers the more technical aspects of pregnancy labor delivery and postpartum you ll learn about what you body is doing how your hormones are working and lot of tips and techniques for helping your body give birth even little things like keeping your mouth and jaw loose ca keep tight mouth and relaxed bottom lot of labor is mind game and using positive language while seeming stupid helps tremendously as well as using visualization to help dialate it great and empowering read you ll do great was terrified as well but it really was so bad woke up in the middle of the night to gas like pains went to pee and found mucus plug so onto the hospital we went it was our induction day anyways get all set up about an hour in kind nurse asks if in any pain say little so she gives me demerol then slept for hours woke up had my waters broken got given pitocin and an epidural and had uneventful hours watching tv til it was time to push the epidural was so easy too guy came in told me to pay attention to the nurse and just relax she had me all cracking up and giggling finally said okay sorry ll be still and he was done did feel thing those guys know what they re doing all in all not bad experience pushing was the worst but that more just exhaustion than pain lol the anticipation of the event is the worst once it happening you re just kinda in the moment and you get through it was terrified of childbirth too and survived my pregnancy by not trying to dwell too much on the birth part always knew that would opt for medicated birth because know do handle pain well and did want traumatic experience if it was not necessary know there lot of guilt out there from certain communities about choosing medicated birth but it is really not harmful to the baby especially if you go the epidural route loved my epidural it turned painful and scary experience for me into nice relaxed labour ended up needing section anyway not complication from the epidural though my baby was just positioned incorrectly to fit through my pelvic opening and attempts at turning him were unsuccessful and was glad in the end that did make myself martyr during my long labour for birth that needed to be medicated in the end anyway had an unmedicated childbirth and hired doula ahead to come with me to the hospital to help me and my husband had great birth contractions come and go so you get breaks in between the hard parts always tell people that it was the worst pain ve been in but not the worst pain can imagine thing to remind yourself that it is bad pain we always associate pain with something bad but in childbirth the pain means your body is doing its job definitely take childbirth class really any kind the one they offer at the hospital are really convenient and educate yourself about what your body will be doing in the big day so you can focus on what you need to do vs what may be going wrong fwiw pregnant with my second and am really looking forward to having an unmedicated birth again epidural 10 10 would do again after it kicked in did feel anything did want them to take it out after she was born what kind of childbirth preparation are you doing some childbirth strategies have fear releasing work built in which sounds like it would be really helpful for you did hypnobabies which was awesome for me 32 weeks is too late to start but would try to start asap hypnobirthing is another similar preparation technique ve been to few hypnobirthing births and they were quite peaceful had wonderfully positive birth experience and immediately after pushing out 10 lbs baby without medication said that was amazing could do that again have you talked with your care provider about your concerns they might be able to refer you to someone you can talk to pm me of you want more information on different childbirth prep techniques there are lots of options you can do this but it is important to find way to let go of your fear stay calm and relaxed as much as possible through the process let your body do the work it was made to do read ina may guide to childbirth felt the same way with my first baby got more and more anxious thinking about the birth the closer got my husband and went to one day birth prep class at our hospital but did do much to make me feel better or worse as you can probably tell by reading all the comments every birth is different but mine was over before knew it or at least that how it felt my water broke two weeks before my due date and we went to the hospital right away in hindsight the whole experience felt quick but we went in the morning and my son was born around 5pmish the contractions did feel horrible until hours into my time at the hospital and after got the epidural pushed two times and it was over anything that happened after had my son was an absolute blur really really hope that this time goes as smoothly as the last time guess the biggest take away from my experience was that was so caught up in the moment that never even had time or the mental capacity to think about half the details worried about beforehand hang in there and try to keep seeing your due date as your independence day from being pregnant haha had no drugs would do it what way again but do judge the epidural or section group the best thing my midwife said for me was when gasped ca do it she said well sweetie you also said that 10 minutes ago but look you re still doing it like no amount of pain is going no to stop the minutes from moving forward or the baby from coming makes it seem scary but it helped me yes came to say this the first chapter with the positive birth stories especially important so wonderful the second thought after finding out was pregnant was the reality would have to push this baby out that fear stuck with me the entire pregnancy the night went into labor was in pure denial by the time got to the hospital was 7cm first thing did was get the epidural and was so happy made that choice labor was as scary after that and even though was so tired from pushing did have to deal with any of the pain was so worried about drugs worked for me do what you think will work for you because labor is only the beginning congrats momma mom of kids get an epidural once you get the epidural labor is not big deal some advice about epidural if it does take away your pain ask the anesthesiologist to reposition it it makes all the difference in the world some people are scared of needles but did think the epidural was big deal this is big piece of the picture that helped me too humans seem to be the only species and recently that have turned labor and delivery into an event every mammal on the planet gives birth we re not even that special in the same vein it helps me to think sort of scientifically about the process and the pain involved the contractions are just pain they re work it hurts but as others say it does generally come on all at once it really gradual and it helped me to picture the muscles all pulling up around to the top of the baby and then pushing the baby from above do know why but that mental image works for me also did lot of visualizing especially with my induced labor fyi pitocin makes less real labor and feels kind of out of control at least for me my teacher in the birthing class had talked about visualizing location that was soothing like beach could think that deep in the moment and ended up just visualizing petting my cat it moved my mind to different place and seemed to help now when my first was born the first words out of my mouth were well could do that again and did we re expecting number five any day now you can do it do worry something clicks at the end and suddenly you wo want anything else except to have the baby it really was so bad took spa music with me and it helped lot its really not so bad had an un medicated natural birth and yes it hurt but its funny kind of pain used to something like breaking bone where it hurts for long time slowly hurting less over time not labor it hurts and then is immediately gone hurts again and is gone no residual hurt between contractions it makes it much easier to get through it just know that every mom who ever existed has been through it it cant be so horrible or we would have died out as species yesssss felt the same exact way what helped me was knowing it what was buit for yeah it hurts but not so bad you ll pass out from it or anything ve had headache that was worse than labor honestly so it sucks but it goes by fast and once it done you get baby and you probably wo even remember the pain you can do this it not so bad not sure why you were downvoted your experience of labor is certainly valid and was well described would only add that everyone experience is different trained as doula and have given birth twice out of hospital and without pain meds my labors were not what you described for one thing they lasted 28 and 20 hours the contractions for me were extremely painful and at one point even begged for an epidural yes in my living room was thinking clearly but even so if were to have another child gods forbid do it at home again the tradeoff of being able to immediately go to sleep in my own bed afterwards was just worth it to me no matter how bad the pain is it over soon enough you re absolutely right though about banishing negativity heck even banished my own doula at one point when we were on the same wavelength and that too was over soon enough everything is temporary deleted things that made me feel better before the birth of my first remember that great majority of women have kids at some point so if they can do it so can you lots even decide to do it more than once so it ca be that bad there are lots of options for pain management epidurals are magic pain is temporary just get through it hour by hour minute by minute and soon it will be distant memory you ve got this like you was terrified of labor have an extremely low pain tolerance and do not do well at all with discomfort of any kind but labor was bliss it truly was contraction were very light at first and slowly got more and more noticeable then the pitocin came and after strong contraction called for the epidural endured more then did feel anything after that was only dialated and while that was really really soon to get an epi it was the best choice for me after my epidural was bed ridden so just layed down and relaxed closed my eyes and daydreamed about my baby hubs had made me special photo album of cute pictures of my cat and it gave me the warm and fuzzies napped the hours in bed were actually nice and gave me energy for pushing that was the best part since felt no pain remember smiling through some of the pushes just felt so strong and empowered and excited to meet my baby then the moment he came out pure bliss not everyone would be cool with spending so much time in bed while in labor but for me skipping out on the pain side allowed me to really enjoy the experience you re gon na do great worked myself up over laboring with my first she was breech and had an emergency section after contracting for 18 hours worried for nothing with my second was way more relaxed knew what contractions felt like they hurt like hell but also trusted my body knew that the baby was coming out one way or another had fantastic vbac giving birth vaginally was so amazing yes there pain but was 100 open to an epidural you can prepare yourself for every scenario but you wo be at peace until you re in it let me put it this way the labor is temporary the parenting part is what hard enjoy your pregnancy ve had three remember being nervous about it every time what helped me was educating myself as best could on what to expect what funny is that when was in it was really scared at all just using all my energy to get through it you will go into your animal mode once you re in labor you can do this do worry about the pain if you re getting an epidural you ll be fine besides you forget it all when you see your baby for the first time my daughter is now and can still remember being in labor however do regret going through it and was traumatized by it either we re women our body were built for this our pain tolerance is higher than men for reason you ll be fine ve given birth twice the first time with an epidural the second with no pain relief not intentionally long story remember being scared of labor the first time it is scary because no one can explain it for you it is an entirely new bodily experience labored for few hours until the pressure was enough that could really talk during contraction know that sounds really terrible but it is not it just intense pressure pain not the right word then got an epidural and my hubby and got to sit calmly and watch my labor progress on the monitor still could feel when baby was coming knew when to push etc but truly no actual pain delivered her vaginally and it is wonderful memory when my son came along things went bit awry long story and though also delivered him vaginally with no complications did not have pain relief if you wind up in situation like mine you will manage it moment by moment you ll breathe in breathe out and give yourself over to the process once you stop fighting it it becomes totally manageable promise you this fear is what hurts so just had to let go and felt very much part of the process do know how to explain it but once birth became something that was doing rather than something that was happening to me was totally fine my only regret about my sons birth is that because of the extreme physical sensations do remember huge chunks of it if you get the epidural you can kick back and watch movie it is that effective if you do get it you will manage just fine when you remember to breathe deeply surrender to the process and let go of all fear good luck to you and congrats on all the joy ahead you can do it what helped me leading up to it was thinking it only day ended up having section so ca speak to giving birth vaginally but it was still only day there was of course recovery afterwards but the scary part was again only day you can hold on for day on my second kiddo ready any day here and still experience some trepidation about giving birth second time my first was average to reasonably good as an experience think for me it comes down to telling myself that regardless of what happens good or bad it is finite experience it will be over and then there baby on your chest to cry happy tears over and honestly its really too late to stop the oncoming train base level acceptance of that is key you ca turn this car around it is going to happen but you will come out all right on the other side and lastly make sure you are well versed in your options for things like pain management support people etc knowledge is power even if things do go to plan at least you can know what might be coming good luck it will be over before you know it you can do it sister just like see couple other women have said also thought lot about how women have been giving birth for literally ever our bodies were made for this this is your body time to shine and show you exactly what it is capable of and promise you you will not be disappointed once you are in the throws of labor you will be thinking more of the end product wittle baby than any of the immediate pain and it also helped to me think about how your body remembers pain you will always remember when something hurt you but you do actually feel that pain again just that it hurt it will all pass and the second you hold your baby in your arms it will all fade into background because all that will matter in that moment is the tiny life that you made inside you and brought into this world you can do it birthed babies with no pain medication one 8lb3oz and one 10lbs 14oz and it was walk in the park but to me it was half as bad as people made it out like it was going to be it all mind over matter and remember what the end result will be the miracle of birth is one of the most amazing experiences you will ever have you wo ever forget that day for the rest of your life so just remember to breath and try to enjoy it promise you will do amazing got my son head out then told my doctor ca do it anymore and he looked up at me and said well you do have choice anymore it happening now push and one more push and my baby was out whew glad did give up bc pretty sure my vagina would have never recovered had just halted the birth at that point 😂😂 recommend this book to everyone get yourself doula estimate 75 of doulas work is done even before you go into labor your doula will be someone you connect and feel comfortable with they will work closely with you to talk about any fears or concerns that you have and can offer you resources to help navigate the minefield of information you will talk with them about every aspect of your birth experience what you like dislike comfort techniques and pain management they can help you achieve an birth outcome in which you feel honored respected and cherished no matter what decisions you make it is your birth only you can decide but in order to decide you need to know all you options getting doula puts you back in control and helps you let go knowing you re in good hands this is your labor do whatever feels right for you be it natural birth with pain management meds or even elective section the only thing that matters at the end of the day is your and your babies health both physical and emotional there is no universal right way to do things you need to do what is right for you you ll do great and at the end of it all it wo really matter because you ll have that sweet baby to focus all of your energy on gave birth months ago after days of contractions and no sleep and have chronic fatigue syndrome so it safe to say was not in the best shape to give birth and was also terrified but in the end it worked out great when it happens you just roll with it even if you re type control freak like me my birth plan home birth no meds went out the window cause was progressing 2cm after days of labor and went to the hospital and got an iv with meds during the pushing was allowed meds and it hurt like crazy but your body just takes over and the doctors will help you plus when you have your baby in your arms best feeling ever try not to worry too much you ca prepare you ca go back just trust that you ll be fine this everyone told me the same thing everyone is saying here the reality is is different for everyone my sister says that she felt no pain my friend says she forgot the pain for me it was the worst back pain ever but once that epidural was able to be put in it was crazy awesome did find the class took to be super amazing but practicing the different breathing daily really helped in the end do say never to anything please keep flexible and open to changing your plans intended to walk around and us bouncing ball during labor but could because every time got up my baby bp went way down so adapted you will find way through promise just talk to the nurses and your birthing partner the nervousness and anxiety around birthing will help in the end because you ll talk and listen and remember more about what you can do when it really counts best of luck see you on the other side loved my epidural the only thing was unhappy about was waiting so long to get it in was nervous but like others have mentioned women have been having babies forever and that was comforting toward the end just wanted him out though and it felt like that would never happen another piece of wisdom my doctor told me no woman has ever been pregnant forever my birthing experience was tough because he decided he wanted to come right as laid down for bed that night after being up all day did want to be one of those people who went to the hospital for false labor so waited and waited from 11pm 3am had been at an appointment days prior and was told was dilated at all finally decided it was probably best to head up there and lo and behold was 7cm dilated the nurse said looks like you re going home with baby holy crap this just got real however since waited so long did not have time for an epidural had to pass an 8lb 11oz baby boy with nothing to help with pain on top of being exhausted from now at this point being up for almost 24 hours there were times when felt like giving up but you find way somehow toward the end around 10am at this point awake for 28 hours now simply did have the strength to push then it happened his vitals started to go he was almost there but because of where he was in me he was starting to lose oxygen the dr told me to either get him out with the next push or was having an emergency section hearing that and seeing the vitals line on the monitor freaking out gave me the strength needed and there was my sweet little boy aiden james you do know what true love honestly unconditional love is until you see that little face you created your heart will swell with happiness and every second of pain you just endured will be worth it lt good luck mama bit late to this but you will be fine your body takes over and knows what to do and you just start getting really excited to meet your baby around 20 weeks started getting terrified and was convinced needed section as would be able to give birth vaginally but listened to great hypnobirthing course the one by kathryn clark whilst did plan to have hypnobirthing experience and did the positive messaging throughout really helped me to believe could do it put my trust in the professionals to look after me and resigned myself to the fact that they would only offer necessary interventions that would result in the safety of me and my baby had an epidural an episiotomy and several blood transfusions and my daughter had monitor attached to her head and was assisted out with kiwi so it was exactly natural but we both came out of the experience perfectly healthy and look back on that couple of days really fondly it was an incredibly special time not long until you ll be holding your beautiful baby in your arms you can do it op had both of mine at home it lot of pressure then pop you ll feel like your crotch is on fire for minute and then they re out and you re mom do stress women have been having babies for thousands of years as long as your birth team is fully supportive of you and let you labor how you want you ll be fine it just like taking an pound poop was really scared my first time too the third trimester felt like this point of no return and while looked forward to meeting my baby reeeeally did want to give birth knowledge is power has always been my approach to scary things so read up like crazy highly recommend the bradley method book we did do the class bc it was 12 weeks long but the book had good pictures and information about stages of labor and what to expect an unmedicated birth to feel like this really helped in the moment so knew this is normal do panic breath ride the contraction waves reading lot of birth stories was good too birth without fear is great resource for this everyone is so different and it was good to hear lots of birth stories felt encouraged that even if things went poorly emergency section was my fear lots of babies are born this way and come out okay that not in any way screw up bc could handle natural labor or whatever if decided needed medication there definitely that vibe in the crunchy community but it bs do what good for you and baby have doctor you trust also took short lamaze style birth class which was good for laboring techniques to not overtire yourself and what to expect with breastfeeding and early postpartum recovery was so wrapped up about the birth had even thought about recovery much glad heard some good tips and had my adult diapers and frozen witch hazel pads at home they helped lot for me labor itself was not painful until very close to pushing my water broke around 2am and around 10am started noticing mild period like cramping it slowly intensified over the day and around 8pm the contractions were close enough together min think consistent intense enough could talk through them anymore so we drove to the birth center we live about an hour away in the country so we wanted to give plenty of time since also reeeeally did want home birth or car birth labored there from 9pm midnight pain management mostly pressure in my lower back was helped by swaying sitting on an exercise ball and hanging out in the shower with warm water hitting my lower back pushed for hours not bad for first baby and that was by far the hardest it did hurt to push per say but it was exhausting and felt sick shaking and wanting to vomit the last hour of pushing was painful and was so tired was insanely happy when the baby came out and could rest my home recovery was good breastfeeding was hard had mastitis twice think flu symptoms and painful nursing and other issues with great lactation consultant we were able to heal up and continue nursing after month or so of needing to supplement that was scarier to me than giving birth the problems felt unending and was exhausted with newborn who was losing weight we came out the other side ok and nursed over years pregnant with now and really hoping birth goes as smooth this time and maybe nursing wo be such challenge as with many other ladies have said get the epidural and take birthing class if you can try to make sure that you have really good support person in amp if not make sure the nurses know they are trained to help oh and the epidural feels really freaking weird going in but well worth it do know what natural labor feels like as was one of the scary stories but listen to the ladies that have replied and remember your body is built for this and follow your instincts while in labor if you need to rock or squat do it regardless of what anyone might think removed think your description is right on had an epidural but was working on my left side for most of my labor the fact that the pain comes and goes makes it faster should have added that even though could have drugs really wanted those drugs it added an element of anxiety but once it was over was ok and was very energetic which hear is normal always hear throughout the whole labor and about day before so my actual labor was hours but was in the hospital maybe day and half just preparing had bed before even got there it was all planned contractions are very interesting and yes they can be painful and even are painful at times but just wanted op to know that she does need to be afraid that contractions are an injury pain and have goal the most nervous scared person on the planet and think something just changed once knew was in labor even before we began was crying lot to the doctors lol what helped me was to remeber that it was short period of time in an otherwise long life it was the start of something amazing the whole risk vs reward thing these nurses are great at what they do they do this everyday and know all the tricks of the trade we also *literally* built for this and if for whatever reason vaginal birth is possible we live in time of medical interventions to keep both and the baby as safe as possible you got this this will be the most amazing thing your body ever does in hindsight it such short amount of time to be in pain and started laboring on friday and had my baby girl monday night once you push that emergency section birth story is in my post history and months later do remember pain but those happy moments my son first scream how cute and small he was how fell in love with him at the first sight do that again as it is so worth it btw as someone above said you will be so miserable towards the end of pregnancy that you will wait till it is over and try everything to speed up the process was scared too what calmed me is this whatever it is that you believe god or nature or what have you they it has designed you for this your hips your muscles your uterus your hormones to deal with how discomfortable it might be they ve all been designed for this moment you do need to do this all natural either there no medal if you do not thinking of this as really painful thing helps my labour does rank in the top three for sure went in not thinking this is really going to hurt but this will be discomfortable also had focus point focused imagined seeing his feet and counting his toes that helped too not sure if that helped all the best think it because you ve made some absolutes here like pushing does hurt there no feeling below and contractions are not bad that incredibly subjective think these kind of comments while coming from generous place of trying to reassure someone can actually add to women feelings of disappointment after the birth thinking why was it so much more or less than people said it would be or why did work it sounds like you re experiencing lot of anxiety and nervousness had that exact same feeling and kept waiting for myself to become ok with it and it just never happened lol have you ever done public speaking public performance taken final or anything else that really tests you and puts you in the spotlight it can be really nerve wracking and even make you want to pass out or throw up what if what if what if but then you get up on stage or start writing and it happening you have no time for panic now because your mind is occupied with the task at hand ve never seen woman in labor saying what do do they re doing it you will have team of people whose sole job it is to take care of you and your needs and your baby you will not be alone in ca move down and baby would need to get out another way thats just the way that looked at it since spent all of my life being afraid of pregnancy and labor meant that contractions are pain from injury or something being wrong but type of pain that is understandable and has goal and end result believe me wanted those drugs but could wo be able to for the next one but it not so bad that wo want to downvoting you did not downvote you know plenty of people who would agree with your statements but they are worded like they apply to everyone and that probably what the issue was ah see what you mean now understand the initial downvotes thanks for explaining epidurals are great if you want one do yourself favor understand that it is never too early to get an epidural do not let nurse or even doctor tell you that it too soon to do it mine said had to wait til was 4cm dilated and not knowing any better waited then dilated really quickly so when they finally checked again was almost 6cm so let get that epidural said well the only nurse anesthetist in the building at the time had just started csection so had to wait even longer had to wait hours after requested the epidural to actually get it here the thing this idea that you have to wait till you re dilated til youre dilated to any particular size to get an epidural is an old outmoded viewpoint work with anesthesiologists every day surgical tech and they were really angry on my behalf that they made me wait the reasoning behind this common practice is that an epidural can sometimes slow down labor but it usually does and if it does all they have to do is give you pitocin this is your choice if they tell you they recommend you wait and you do want to you tell them that you understand the risks and theyre relatively minor compared to the pain and you would like to get your epidural now please also even if your only considering an epidural fill out all the paperwork consenting to it as soon as you arrive as it takes time for the nurses to process it and you dpwont want to fill it out when you re in pain that way as soon as you decide to get it you can see you do have to be in pain even at the beginning nothing to fear once mine went in did feel thing and all felt of the epidural was the burn of local anesthetic not bad
